abstract: For many Wall Street chief executives, the penalty for getting it wrong these days is a cushy exit package. By that logic, David Weidner, the MarketWatch columnist, argues that he should be getting a big windfall for his not-so-prescient predictions for 2007. (One of them was that Wells Fargo and Wachovia would merge.)
